channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Council of Europe agrees to look at how ECHR applied in face of ‘challenges posed by irregular migration’ – UK politics live
item.description: Council says work will begin on adopting the declaration in Moldova in May Reeves is now being asked about the leak to the Financial Times on 13 Novem...

item.title: Federal judge grants justice department request to unseal Jeffrey Epstein grand jury documents – US politics live
item.description: Richard M Berman cites passage of Epstein Files Transparency Act, which requires the DoJ to release all Epstein records by 19 December A federal judge...

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration’s deployment of national guard troops in Los Angeles
item.description: Judge ordered the guard, deployed to the city in June, returned to the control of the California governor US politics live – latest updates A US judge...

item.title: Nobel peace prize winner says ‘Venezuela will breathe again’ as she is awarded prize in absentia – Europe live
item.description: María Corina Machado misses ceremony but her daughter says she is ‘safe’ and due in Oslo in ‘just a few hours’ Jørgen Watne Frydnes, chair of the Norw...

item.title: Trump has confirmed Europeans’ worst fears. Are their leaders ready to stand up to him now?
item.description: The White House has formalised its contempt for ‘decaying’ Europe with an ominous plan to undermine the EU and boost the far right Don’t get This Is E...

item.title: Judge rules Epstein grand jury records from 2019 case can be released
item.description: A federal judge says materials from the investigation can be unsealed because of a new law passed by Congress last month.

item.title: Sophie Kinsella, author of the bestselling Shopaholic series, dies aged 55
item.description: The author of the Shopaholic series of novels had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer.

item.title: WTA signs with Mercedes in 'most significant deal in our history'
item.description: The Women's Tennis Association announces a long-term partnership with Mercedes-Benz that has the potential to be the largest in women's sport.

item.title: Ukraine 'ready for elections' if partners guarantee security, Zelensky says
item.description: He was speaking after US President Donald Trump repeated claims Kyiv was "using war" to avoid elections.

item.title: British paratrooper who died in Ukraine named
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer pays tribute to Lance Corporal George Hooley, who the Ministry of Defence says died in a "tragic accident" away from the front lines.
